snippet: After months of failure to achieve a basic cease-fire in Syria, Kofi Annan cited government intransigence, rebel militancy and lack of support from a split United Nations Security Council.
abstract: Kofi Annan, after months of failure to achieve a basic cease-fire in Syria, resigns as special peace envoy of the United Nations and the Arab League; blames government intransigence, rebel militancy and lack of support from a split United Nations Security Council; move throws new doubts on whether a diplomatic solution for Syria is possible.

byline.contributor: Christine Hauser contributed reporting from New York, and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: After months of failure to achieve a basic cease-fire in Syria, Kofi Annan cited government intransigence, rebel militancy and lack of support from a split United Nations Security Council.

headline.main: Resigning as Envoy to Syria, Annan Casts Wide Blame
headline.print_headline: Annan Steps Down as Peace Envoy and Cites Barriers in Syria and United Nations

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
